body_html:
@lucifer6666 Could you please elaborate on the problem adding all other relevant information to your log? Formatting your stack-trace in code blocks helps as well.
Check the Issue template for reference on how you could provide that so we can better help you.

With the limited information I can only conclude by looking at your log that you seem to not have the right permissions to access flower_photos locally, so it's not a TensorFlow bug but a permission issue on your side.
I could give a wild guess to run your prompt as administrator so you can have read/write permissions over those files when executing the scripts.
If it's not that make sure your user in your machine have the correct permissions or your talk to its administrator to concede it to you.

body:
@lucifer6666 Could you please elaborate on the problem adding all other relevant information to your log? Formatting your stack-trace in code blocks helps as well.
Check the Issue template for reference on how you could provide that so we can better help you.

With the limited information I can only conclude by looking at your log that you seem to not have the right permissions to access `flower_photos` locally, so it's not a TensorFlow bug but a permission issue on your side. 
I could give a wild guess to run your prompt as administrator so you can have read/write permissions over those files when executing the scripts.
If it's not that make sure your user in your machine have the correct permissions or your talk to its administrator to concede it to you.
